member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalDPI
member.summary: The horizontal DPI (dots per inch). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format. Note: JFIF (JPEG) files may contain either DPI or DPM or just the aspect ratio. Windows BMP files will contain DPM. Other formats may support any combination, including none at all.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalDPI
member.summary: The vertical DPI (dots per inch). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalDPM
member.summary: The horizontal DPM (dots per meter). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalDPM
member.summary: The vertical DPM (dots per meter). Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.HorizontalAspectRatio
member.summary: The horizontal component of the aspect ratio. Can be 0 if not supported by the image format. Note: Aspect ratio will be set if either DPI or DPM was set, but may also be available in the absence of both DPI and DPM.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.VerticalAspectRatio
member.summary: The vertical component of the aspect ratio. Can be 0 if not supported by the image format.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.ImageInformation.ColorsUsed
member.summary: The colors used. Only valid for images with palettes, will be 0 otherwise.

member.summary: The new content entirely replaces the old content and any subsequent drawing in done on a blank page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphicsUnit.Presentation
member.summary: Specifies a presentation point (1/96 inch) as the unit of measure.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineAlignment.BaseLine
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned relative to its base line. With this option the layout rectangle must have a height of 0.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode
member.summary: Specifies the direction of a linear gradient.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from left to right.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from top to bottom.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.ForwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper left to lower right.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLinearGradientMode.BackwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies a gradient from upper right to lower left.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the available cap styles with which an XPen object can start and end a line.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineCap.Flat
member.summary: Specifies a flat line cap.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineCap.Round
member.summary: Specifies a round line cap.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineCap.Square
member.summary: Specifies a square line cap.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies how to join consecutive line or curve segments in a figure or subpath.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Specifies a mitered join. This produces a sharp corner or a clipped corner, depending on whether the length of the miter exceeds the miter limit

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Specifies a circular join. This produces a smooth, circular arc between the lines.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Specifies a beveled join. This produces a diagonal corner.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XMatrixOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order for matrix transform operations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Prepend
member.summary: The new operation is applied before the old operation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XMatrixOrder.Append
member.summary: The new operation is applied after the old operation.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPageDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the y-axis.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPageDirection.Downwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go downwards. This is the default.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPageDirection.Upwards
member.summary: Increasing Y values go upwards. This is only possible when drawing on a PDF page. It is not implemented when drawing on a System.Drawing.Graphics object.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode
member.summary: Specifies whether smoothing (or antialiasing) is applied to lines and curves and the edges of filled areas.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Invalid
member.summary: Specifies an invalid mode.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies the default mode.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighSpeed
member.summary: Specifies high speed, low quality rendering.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.HighQuality
member.summary: Specifies high quality, low speed rendering.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.None
member.summary: Specifies no antialiasing.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSmoothingMode.AntiAlias
member.summary: Specifies antialiased rendering.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStringAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a text string relative to its layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStyleSimulations
member.summary: Describes the simulation style of a font.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.None
member.summary: No font style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.BoldSimulation
member.summary: Bold style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.ItalicSimulation
member.summary: Italic style simulation.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XStyleSimulations.BoldItalicSimulation
member.summary: Bold and Italic style simulation.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSweepDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction an elliptical arc is drawn.

member.summary: Specifies that arcs are drawn in a counter clockwise (negative-angle) direction.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XSweepDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Specifies that arcs are drawn in a clockwise (positive-angle) direction.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from a 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified 8-bit color values (red, green, and blue). The alpha value is implicitly 255 (fully opaque).

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.FromArgb(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the four ARGB component (alpha, red, green, and blue) values.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified System.Drawing.Color.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified alpha value and color.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified CMYK values.

member.summary: Creates an XColor structure from the specified gray value.

member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified pre-defined color.

member.summary: Creates an XColor from the specified name of a pre-defined color.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.IsKnownColor
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this color is a known color.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.GetHue
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) hue value, in degrees, for this color.
member.returns: The hue, in degrees, of this color. The hue is measured in degrees, ranging from 0 through 360, in HSB color space.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.GetSaturation
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) saturation value for this color.
member.returns: The saturation of this color. The saturation ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 is grayscale and 1 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.GetBrightness
member.summary: Gets the hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) brightness value for this color.
member.returns: The brightness of this color. The brightness ranges from 0 through 1, where 0 represents black and 1 represents white.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.RgbChanged
member.summary: One of the RGB values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.CmykChanged
member.summary: One of the CMYK values changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.GrayChanged
member.summary: The gray scale value changed; recalculate other color representations.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.A
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha value the specifies the transparency. The value is in the range from 1 (opaque) to 0 (completely transparent).

member.summary: Gets or sets the red value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.G
member.summary: Gets or sets the green value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.B
member.summary: Gets or sets the blue value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.Rgb
member.summary: Gets the RGB part value of the color. Internal helper function.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.Argb
member.summary: Gets the ARGB part value of the color. Internal helper function.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.C
member.summary: Gets or sets the cyan value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.M
member.summary: Gets or sets the magenta value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the yellow value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.K
member.summary: Gets or sets the black (or key) value.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XColor.GS
member.summary: Gets or sets the gray scale value.

member.summary: A GDI+ font object is used to setup the internal font objects.

member.summary: Code separated from Metric getter to make code easier to debug. (Setup properties in their getters caused side effects during debugging because Visual Studio calls a getter to early to show its value in a debugger window.)

member.summary: Gets the XFontFamily object associated with this XFont object.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.Name
member.summary: WRONG: Gets the face name of this Font object. Indeed it returns the font family name.

member.summary: Gets the em-size of this font measured in the unit of this font object.

member.summary: Gets style information for this Font object.

member.summary: Indicates whether this XFont object is bold.

member.summary: Gets the cell space for the font. The CellSpace is the line spacing, the sum of CellAscent and CellDescent and optionally some extra space.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.CellAscent
member.summary: Gets the cell ascent, the area above the base line that is used by the font.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.CellDescent
member.summary: Gets the cell descent, the area below the base line that is used by the font.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.Metrics
member.summary: Gets the font metrics.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.GetHeight
member.summary: Returns the line spacing, in pixels, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of the character itself.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.GetHeight(PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics)
member.summary: Returns the line spacing, in the current unit of a specified Graphics object, of this font. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text. Thus, the line spacing includes the blank space between lines along with the height of

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.Height
member.summary: Gets the line spacing of this font.

member.summary: Override style simulations by using the value of StyleSimulations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.StyleSimulations
member.summary: Used to enforce style simulations by renderer. For development purposes only.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFont.GdiFontFamily
member.summary: Gets the GDI family.

member.summary: Implicit conversion form Font to XFont

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The family name of a font.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from FontFamilyInternal.

member.summary: An XGlyphTypeface for a font source that comes from a custom font resolver creates a solitary font family exclusively for it.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFontFamily.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the font family.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XFontFamily.GetCellAscent(PdfSharp.Drawing.XFontStyle)
member.summary: Returns the cell ascent, in design units, of the XFontFamily object of the specified style.

member.summary: Returns the line spacing, in design units, of the FontFamily object of the specified style. The line spacing is the vertical distance between the base lines of two consecutive lines of text.

member.summary: Indicates whether the specified FontStyle enumeration is available.

member.summary: Returns an array that contains all the FontFamily objects associated with the current graphics context.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XForm.DrawingFinished
member.summary: This function should be called when drawing the content of this form is finished. The XGraphics object used for drawing the content is disposed by this function and cannot be used for any further drawing operations. PDFsharp automatically calls this function when this form was used the first time in a DrawImage function.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.Save
member.summary: Saves the current state of this XGraphics object and identifies the saved state with the returned XGraphicsState object.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.Restore(PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphicsState)
member.summary: Restores the state of this XGraphics object to the state represented by the specified XGraphicsState object.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.Restore
member.summary: Restores the state of this XGraphics object to the state before the most recently call of Save.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.BeginContainer
member.summary: Saves a graphics container with the current state of this XGraphics and opens and uses a new graphics container.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.EndContainer(PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphicsContainer)
member.summary: Closes the current graphics container and restores the state of this XGraphics to the state saved by a call to the BeginContainer method.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.GraphicsStateLevel
member.summary: Gets the current graphics state level. The default value is 0. Each call of Save or BeginContainer increased and each call of Restore or EndContainer decreased the value by 1.

member.summary: Applies the specified rotation operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.RotateAtTransform(System.Double,PdfSharp.Drawing.XPoint,PdfSharp.Drawing.XMatrixOrder)
member.summary: Applies the specified rotation operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.ShearTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfSharp.Drawing.XMatrixOrder)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object in the specified order. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.SkewAtTransform(System.Double,System.Double,PdfSharp.Drawing.XPoint)
member.summary: Applies the specified shearing operation to the transformation matrix of this object by prepending it to the object's transformation matrix. ShearTransform is a synonym for SkewAtTransform. Parameter shearX specifies the horizontal skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the y-axis. Parameter shearY specifies the vertical skew which is measured in degrees counterclockwise from the x-axis.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphics.Transform

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XGraphicsPath.SimulateBaselineOffset(PdfSharp.Drawing.XFontFamily,PdfSharp.Drawing.XFontStyle,System.Double,PdfSharp.Drawing.XStringFormat)
member.summary: Calculates the offset for BaseLine positioning simulation: In GDI we have only Near, Center and Far as LineAlignment and no BaseLine. For XLineAlignment.BaseLine StringAlignment.Near is returned. We now return the negative drawed ascender height. This has to be added to the LayoutRect/Origin before each _gdipPath.AddString().

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm
member.summary: Represents a so called 'PDF form external object', which is typically an imported page of an external PDF document. XPdfForm objects are used like images to draw an existing PDF page of an external document in the current document. XPdfForm objects can only be placed in PDF documents. If you try to draw them using a XGraphics based on an GDI+ context no action is taken if no placeholder image is specified. Otherwise the place holder is drawn.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XPdfForm class from the specified path to an external PDF document. Although PDFsharp internally caches XPdfForm objects it is recommended to reuse XPdfForm objects in your code and change the PageNumber property if more than one page is needed form the external document. Furthermore, because XPdfForm can occupy very much memory, it is recommended to dispose XPdfForm objects if not needed anymore.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a stream.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a file.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates an XPdfForm from a stream.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Finish
member.summary: Sets the form in the state FormState.Finished.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Frees the memory occupied by the underlying imported PDF document, even if other XPdfForm objects refer to this document. A reuse of this object doesn't fail, because the underlying PDF document is re-imported if necessary.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets or sets an image that is used for drawing if the current XGraphics object cannot handle PDF forms. A place holder is useful for showing a preview of a page on the display, because PDFsharp cannot render native PDF objects.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Page
member.summary: Gets the underlying PdfPage (if one exists).

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of pages in the PDF form.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Width
member.summary: Gets the width in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Height
member.summary: Gets the height in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PointWidth
member.summary: Gets the width in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PointHeight
member.summary: Gets the height in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PixelWidth
member.summary: Gets the width in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PixelHeight
member.summary: Gets the height in point of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Size
member.summary: Get the size of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the transformation matrix.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page number is one-based, i.e. it is in the range from 1 to PageCount. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the page index in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page index is zero-based, i.e. it is in the range from 0 to PageCount - 1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExternalDocument
member.summary: Gets the underlying document from which pages are imported.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExtractPageNumber(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Extracts the page number if the path has the form 'MyFile.pdf#123' and returns the actual path without the number sign and the following digits.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.CMapTable
member.summary: This table defines the mapping of character codes to the glyph index values used in the font. It may contain more than one subtable, in order to support more than one character encoding scheme.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.CMapTable.symbol
member.summary: Is true for symbol font encoding.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.CMapTable.#ctor(PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.OpenTypeFontface)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.FontHeaderTable
member.summary: This table gives global information about the font. The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.HorizontalHeaderTable
member.summary: This table contains information for horizontal layout. The values in the minRightSidebearing, MinLeftSideBearing and xMaxExtent should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations. All reserved areas must be set to 0.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.HorizontalMetricsTable
member.summary: The type longHorMetric is defined as an array where each element has two parts: the advance width, which is of type USHORT, and the left side bearing, which is of type SHORT. These fields are in font design units.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.VerticalMetricsTable
member.summary: The vertical Metrics table allows you to specify the vertical spacing for each glyph in a vertical font. This table consists of either one or two arrays that contain metric information (the advance heights and top sidebearings) for the vertical layout of each of the glyphs in the font.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.MaximumProfileTable
member.summary: This table establishes the memory requirements for this font. Fonts with CFF data must use Version 0.5 of this table, specifying only the numGlyphs field. Fonts with TrueType outlines must use Version 1.0 of this table, where all data is required. Both formats of OpenType require a 'maxp' table because a number of applications call the Windows GetFontData() API on the 'maxp' table to determine the number of glyphs in the font.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.NameTable
member.summary:
The naming table allows multilingual strings to be associated with the OpenTypeTM font file. These strings can represent copyright notices, font names, family names, style names, and so on. To keep this table short, the font manufacturer may wish to make a limited set of entries in some small set of languages; later, the font can be "localized" and the strings translated or added. Other parts of the OpenType font file that require these strings can then refer to them simply by their index number. Clients that need a particular string can look it up by its platform ID, character encoding ID, language ID and name ID. Note that some platforms may require single byte character strings, while others may require double byte strings.
For historical reasons, some applications which install fonts perform Version control using Macintosh platform (platform ID 1) strings from the 'name' table. Because of this, we strongly recommend that the 'name' table of all fonts include Macintosh platform strings and that the syntax of the Version number (name id 5) follows the guidelines given in this document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.NameTable.Name
member.summary: Get the font family name.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.NameTable.Style
member.summary: Get the font subfamily name.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.NameTable.FullFontName
member.summary: Get the full font name.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.OS2Table
member.summary: The OS/2 table consists of a set of Metrics that are required in OpenType fonts.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.PostScriptTable
member.summary: This table contains additional information needed to use TrueType or OpenTypeTM fonts on PostScript printers.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.ControlValueTable
member.summary: This table contains a list of values that can be referenced by instructions. They can be used, among other things, to control characteristics for different glyphs. The length of the table must be an integral number of FWORD units.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.FontProgram
member.summary: This table is similar to the CVT Program, except that it is only run once, when the font is first used. It is used only for FDEFs and IDEFs. Thus the CVT Program need not contain function definitions. However, the CVT Program may redefine existing FDEFs or IDEFs.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.ControlValueProgram
member.summary: The Control Value Program consists of a set of TrueType instructions that will be executed whenever the font or point size or transformation matrix change and before each glyph is interpreted. Any instruction is legal in the CVT Program but since no glyph is associated with it, instructions intended to move points within a particular glyph outline cannot be used in the CVT Program. The name 'prep' is anachronistic.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Fonts.OpenType.GlyphSubstitutionTable
member.summary: This table contains information that describes the glyphs in the font in the TrueType outline format. Information regarding the rasterizer (scaler) refers to the TrueType rasterizer.

member.summary: The name of the default font.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings.FontResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the global font resolver for the current application domain. This static function must be called only once and before any font operation was executed by PDFsharp. If this is not easily to obtain, e.g. because your code is running on a web server, you must provide the same instance of your font resolver in every subsequent setting of this property. In a web application set the font resolver in Global.asax.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Fonts.GlobalFontSettings.DefaultFontEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font encoding used for XFont objects where encoding is not explicitly specified. If it is not set, the default value is PdfFontEncoding.Unicode. If you are sure your document contains only Windows-1252 characters (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows-1252) set default encoding to PdfFontEncodingj.Windows1252. Must be set only once per app domain.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Forms.PagePreview._printableArea
member.summary: Printable area in point.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Forms.PagePreviewCanvas
member.summary: Implements the control that previews the page.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags
member.summary: Specifies the flags of AcroForm fields.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a checkbox. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the field’s text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters. To protect password confidentiality, viewer applications should never store the value of the text field in the PDF file if this flag is set.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckTextField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the field will not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than will fit within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text will be accepted.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Edit
F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the field’s option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications; viewers should simply display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, more than one of the field’s option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckChoiseField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo and Edit flags are both set.

For your convenience an instance of a derived class like PdfTextField or PdfCheckBox is returned if PDFsharp can guess the actual type of the dictionary. If the actual type cannot be guessed by PDFsharp the function returns an instance of PdfGenericField.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.FT
member.summary: (Required for terminal fields; inheritable) The type of field that this dictionary describes: Btn Button Tx Text Ch Choice Sig (PDF 1.3) Signature Note: This entry may be present in a nonterminal field (one whose descendants are themselves fields) in order to provide an inheritable FT value. However, a nonterminal field does not logically have a type of its own; it is merely a container for inheritable attributes that are intended for descendant terminal fields of any type.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required if this field is the child of another in the field hierarchy; absent otherwise) The field that is the immediate parent of this one (the field, if any, whose Kids array includes this field). A field can have at most one parent; that is, it can be included in the Kids array of at most one other field.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Kids
member.summary: (Optional) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this field.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.T
member.summary: (Optional) The partial field name.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TU
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An alternate field name, to be used in place of the actual field name wherever the field must be identified in the user interface (such as in error or status messages referring to the field). This text is also useful when extracting the document’s contents in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The mapping name to be used when exporting interactive form field data from the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Ff
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the field. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.V
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The field’s value, whose format varies depending on the field type; see the descriptions of individual field types for further information.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DV
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The default value to which the field reverts when a reset-form action is executed. The format of this value is the same as that of V.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining the field’s behavior in response to various trigger events. This entry has exactly the same meaning as the AA entry in an annotation dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A resource dictionary containing default resources (such as fonts, patterns, or color spaces) to be used by the appearance stream. At a minimum, this dictionary must contain a Font entry specifying the resource name and font dictionary of the default font for displaying the field’s text.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The default appearance string, containing a sequence of valid page-content graphics or text state operators defining such properties as the field’s text size and color.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A code specifying the form of quadding (justification) to be used in displaying the text: 0 Left-justified 1 Centered 2 Right-justified Default value: 0 (left-justified).

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm
member.summary: Represents an interactive form (or AcroForm), a collection of fields for gathering information interactively from the user.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of AcroForm.

member.summary: Gets the fields collection of this form.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Fields
member.summary: (Required) An array of references to the document’s root fields (those with no ancestors in the field hierarchy).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.NeedAppearances
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to construct appearance streams and appearance dictionaries for all widget annotations in the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.SigFlags
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A set of flags specifying various document-level characteristics related to signature fields. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.CO
member.summary: (Required if any fields in the document have additional-actions dictionaries containing a C entry; PDF 1.3) An array of indirect references to field dictionaries with calculation actions, defining the calculation order in which their values will be recalculated when the value of any field changes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DR attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DA attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the Q attribute of variable text fields.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the index of the specified string in the /Opt array or -1, if no such string exists.

member.summary: Gets the value from the index in the /Opt array.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.Opt
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) An array of options to be presented to the user. Each element of the array is either a text string representing one of the available options or a two-element array consisting of a text string together with a default appearance string for constructing the item’s appearance dynamically at viewing time.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.TI
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) For scrollable list boxes, the top index (the index in the Opt array of the first option visible in the list).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.I
member.summary: (Sometimes required, otherwise optional; inheritable; PDF 1.4) For choice fields that allow multiple selection (MultiSelect flag set), an array of integers, sorted in ascending order, representing the zero-based indices in the Opt array of the currently selected option items. This entry is required when two or more elements in the Opt array have different names but the same export value, or when the value of the choice field is an array; in other cases, it is permitted but not required. If the items identified by this entry differ from those in the V entry of the field dictionary (see below), the V entry takes precedence.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField
member.summary: Represents the signature field.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.#ctor(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of PdfSignatureField.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Sig for a signature dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The name of the signature handler to be used for authenticating the field’s contents, such as Adobe.PPKLite, Entrust.PPKEF, CICI.SignIt, or VeriSign.PPKVS.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.SubFilter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a specific submethod of the specified handler.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.ByteRange
member.summary: (Required) An array of pairs of integers (starting byte offset, length in bytes) describing the exact byte range for the digest calculation. Multiple discontinuous byte ranges may be used to describe a digest that does not include the signature token itself.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Required) The encrypted signature token.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Optional) The name of the person or authority signing the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.M
member.summary: (Optional) The time of signing. Depending on the signature handler, this may be a normal unverified computer time or a time generated in a verifiable way from a secure time server.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Location
member.summary: (Optional) The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Reason
member.summary: (Optional) The reason for the signing, such as (I agree…).

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.summary: Dispatches PrepareForSave to the objects that need it.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Catalog for the catalog dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Version
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The version of the PDF specification to which the document conforms (for example, 1.4) if later than the version specified in the file’s header. If the header specifies a later version, or if this entry is absent, the document conforms to the version specified in the header. This entry enables a PDF producer application to update the version using an incremental update.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Pages
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the root of the document’s page tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLabels
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A number tree defining the page labeling for the document. The keys in this tree are page indices; the corresponding values are page label dictionaries. Each page index denotes the first page in a labeling range to which the specified page label dictionary applies. The tree must include a value for pageindex 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Names
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The document’s name dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Dests
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) A dictionary of names and corresponding destinations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A viewer preferences dictionary specifying the way the document is to be displayed on the screen. If this entry is absent, applications should use their own current user preference settings.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLayout
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying the page layout to be used when the document is opened: SinglePage - Display one page at a time. OneColumn - Display the pages in one column. TwoColumnLeft - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the left. TwoColumnRight - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the right. TwoPageLeft - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the left TwoPageRight - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageMode
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened: UseNone - Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible. UseOutlines - Document outline visible. UseThumbs - Thumbnail images visible. FullScreen - Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, windowcontrols, or any other window visible. UseOC - (PDF 1.5) Optional content group panel visible. UseAttachments (PDF 1.6) Attachments panel visible. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Outlines
member.summary: (Optional; must be an indirect reference) The outline dictionary that is the root of the document’s outline hierarchy.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Threads
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) An array of thread dictionaries representing the document’s article threads.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OpenAction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A value specifying a destination to be displayed or an action to be performed when the document is opened. The value is either an array defining a destination or an action dictionary representing an action. If this entry is absent, the document should be opened to the top of the first page at the default magnification factor.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) An additional-actions dictionary defining the actions to be taken in response to various trigger events affecting the document as a whole.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.URI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A URI dictionary containing document-level information for URI (uniform resource identifier) actions.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.AcroForm
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The document’s interactive form (AcroForm) dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4; must be an indirect reference) A metadata stream containing metadata for the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.StructTreeRoot
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The document’s structure tree root dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.MarkInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A mark information dictionary containing information about the document’s usage of Tagged PDF conventions.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Lang
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A language identifier specifying the natural language for all text in the document except where overridden by language specifications for structure elements or marked content. If this entry is absent, the language is considered unknown.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.SpiderInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A Web Capture information dictionary containing state information used by the Acrobat Web Capture (AcroSpider) plugin extension.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OutputIntents
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) An array of output intent dictionaries describing the color characteristics of output devices on which the document might be rendered.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PieceInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A page-piece dictionary associated with the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OCProperties
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; required if a document contains optional content) The document’s optional content properties dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Perms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A permissions dictionary that specifies user access permissions for the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Legal
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A dictionary containing attestations regarding the content of a PDF document, as it relates to the legality of digital signatures.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Requirements
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.7) An array of requirement dictionaries representing requirements for the document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Collection
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.7) A collection dictionary that a PDF consumer uses to enhance the presentation of file attachments stored in the PDF document.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.NeedsRendering
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.7) A flag used to expedite the display of PDF documents containing XFA forms. It specifies whether the document must be regenerated when the document is first opened. If true, the viewer application treats the document as a shell and regenerates the content when the document is opened, regardless of any dynamic forms settings that appear in the XFA stream itself. This setting is used to expedite the display of documents whose layout varies depending on the content of the XFA streams. If false, the viewer application does not regenerate the content when the document is opened. See the XML Forms Architecture (XFA) Specification (Bibliography). Default value: false.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Font for a CIDFont dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of CIDFont; CIDFontType0 or CIDFontType2.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.BaseFont
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the CIDFont. For Type 0 CIDFonts, this is usually the value of the CIDFontName entry in the CIDFont program. For Type 2 CIDFonts, it is derived the same way as for a simple TrueType font; In either case, the name can have a subset prefix if appropriate.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDSystemInfo
member.summary: (Required) A dictionary containing entries that define the character collection of the CIDFont.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the CIDFont’s default metrics other than its glyph widths.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW
member.summary: (Optional) The default width for glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: 1000.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W
member.summary: (Optional) A description of the widths for the glyphs in the CIDFont. The array’s elements have a variable format that can specify individual widths for consecutive CIDs or one width for a range of CIDs. Default value: none (the DW value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) An array of two numbers specifying the default metrics for vertical writing. Default value: [880 −1000].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) A description of the metrics for vertical writing for the glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: none (the DW2 value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDToGIDMap
member.summary: (Optional; Type 2 CIDFonts only) A specification of the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices. If the value is a stream, the bytes in the stream contain the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices: the glyph index for a particular CID value c is a 2-byte value stored in bytes 2 × c and 2 × c + 1, where the first byte is the high-order byte. If the value of CIDToGIDMap is a name, it must be Identity, indicating that the mapping between CIDs and glyph indices is the identity mapping. Default value: Identity. This entry may appear only in a Type 2 CIDFont whose associated True-Type font program is embedded in the PDF file.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream
member.summary: Represents a PDF cross-reference stream.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.#ctor(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys for cross-reference dictionaries.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be XRef for a cross-reference stream.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys.Size
member.summary: (Required) The number one greater than the highest object number used in this section or in any section for which this is an update. It is equivalent to the Size entry in a trailer dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys.Index
member.summary: (Optional) An array containing a pair of integers for each subsection in this section. The first integer is the first object number in the subsection; the second integer is the number of entries in the subsection. The array is sorted in ascending order by object number. Subsections cannot overlap; an object number may have at most one entry in a section. Default value: [0 Size].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys.Prev
member.summary: (Present only if the file has more than one cross-reference stream; not meaningful in hybrid-reference files) The byte offset from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the previous cross-reference stream. This entry has the same function as the Prev entry in the trailer dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCrossReferenceStream.Keys.W
member.summary:
(Required) An array of integers representing the size of the fields in a single cross-reference entry. The table describes the types of entries and their fields. For PDF 1.5, W always contains three integers; the value of each integer is the number of bytes (in the decoded stream) of the corresponding field. For example, [1 2 1] means that the fields are one byte, two bytes, and one byte, respectively.
A value of zero for an element in the W array indicates that the corresponding field is not present in the stream, and the default value is used, if there is one. If the first element is zero, the type field is not present, and it defaults to type 1.
The sum of the items is the total length of each entry; it can be used with the Indexarray to determine the starting position of each subsection.
Note: Different cross-reference streams in a PDF file may use different values for W.
Entries in a cross-reference stream.
TYPE FIELD DESCRIPTION 0 1 The type of this entry, which must be 0. Type 0 entries define the linked list of free objects (corresponding to f entries in a cross-reference table). 2 The object number of the next free object. 3 The generation number to use if this object number is used again. 1 1 The type of this entry, which must be 1. Type 1 entries define objects that are in use but are not compressed (corresponding to n entries in a cross-reference table). 2 The byte offset of the object, starting from the beginning of the file. 3 The generation number of the object. Default value: 0. 2 1 The type of this entry, which must be 2. Type 2 entries define compressed objects. 2 The object number of the object stream in which this object is stored. (The generation number of the object stream is implicitly 0.) 3 The index of this object within the object stream.

member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be ExtGState for a graphics state parameter dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LW
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line width (see “Line Width” on page 185).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line cap style.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LJ
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line join style.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.ML
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The miter limit.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.D
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line dash pattern, expressed as an array of the form [dashArray dashPhase], where dashArray is itself an array and dashPhase is an integer.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.RI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The name of the rendering intent.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OP
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint. In PDF 1.2 and earlier, there is a single overprint parameter that applies to all painting operations. Beginning with PDF 1.3, there are two separate overprint parameters: one for stroking and one for all other painting operations. Specifying an OP entry sets both parameters unless there is also an op entry in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, in which case the OP entry sets only the overprint parameter for stroking.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.op
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint for painting operations other than stroking. If this entry is absent, the OP entry, if any, sets this parameter.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OPM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The overprint mode.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.Font
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of the form [font size], where font is an indirect reference to a font dictionary and size is a number expressed in text space units. These two objects correspond to the operands of the Tf operator; however, the first operand is an indirect object reference instead of a resource name.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG
member.summary: (Optional) The black-generation function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [0.0 1.0].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as BG except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the black-generation function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both BG and BG2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, BG2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR
member.summary: (Optional) The undercolor-removal function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [-1.0 1.0].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as UCR except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the undercolor-removal function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both UCR and UCR2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, UCR2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SA
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply automatic stroke adjustment.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current blend mode to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current soft mask, specifying the mask shape or mask opacity values to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.CA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current stroking alpha constant, specifying the constant shape or constant opacity value to be used for stroking operations in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.ca
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) Same as CA, but for nonstroking operations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.AIS
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The alpha source flag (“alpha is shape”), specifying whether the current soft mask and alpha constant are to be interpreted as shape values (true) or opacity values (false).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.TK
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The text knockout flag, which determines the behavior of overlapping glyphs within a text object in the transparent imaging model.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.summary: Adds a tag of exactly six uppercase letters to the font name according to PDF Reference Section 5.5.3 'Font Subsets'

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys common to all font dictionaries.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Font for a font dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of font.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.BaseFont
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required except for the standard 14 fonts; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the font’s metrics other than its glyph widths. Note: For the standard 14 fonts, the entries FirstChar, LastChar, Widths, and FontDescriptor must either all be present or all be absent. Ordinarily, they are absent; specifying them enables a standard font to be overridden.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags
member.summary: The PDF font descriptor flags.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.FixedPitch
member.summary: All glyphs have the same width (as opposed to proportional or variable-pitch fonts, which have different widths).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Serif
member.summary: Glyphs have serifs, which are short strokes drawn at an angle on the top and bottom of glyph stems. (Sans serif fonts do not have serifs.)

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Symbolic
member.summary: Font contains glyphs outside the Adobe standard Latin character set. This flag and the Nonsymbolic flag cannot both be set or both be clear.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Script
member.summary: Glyphs resemble cursive handwriting.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Nonsymbolic
member.summary: Font uses the Adobe standard Latin character set or a subset of it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Italic
member.summary: Glyphs have dominant vertical strokes that are slanted.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.AllCap
member.summary: Font contains no lowercase letters; typically used for display purposes, such as for titles or headlines.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.SmallCap
member.summary: Font contains both uppercase and lowercase letters. The uppercase letters are similar to those in the regular version of the same typeface family. The glyphs for the lowercase letters have the same shapes as the corresponding uppercase letters, but they are sized and their proportions adjusted so that they have the same size and stroke weight as lowercase glyphs in the same typeface family.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.ForceBold
member.summary: Determines whether bold glyphs are painted with extra pixels even at very small text sizes.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor
member.summary: A PDF font descriptor specifies metrics and other attributes of a simple font, as distinct from the metrics of individual glyphs.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is symbol font.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be FontDescriptor for a font descriptor.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontName
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font. This name should be the same as the value of BaseFont in the font or CIDFont dictionary that refers to this font descriptor.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFamily
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) A string specifying the preferred font family name. For example, for the font Times Bold Italic, the FontFamily is Times.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontStretch
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The font stretch value. It must be one of the following names (ordered from narrowest to widest): UltraCondensed, ExtraCondensed, Condensed, SemiCondensed, Normal, SemiExpanded, Expanded, ExtraExpanded or UltraExpanded. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, Condensed in one font may appear most similar to Normal in another.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontWeight
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The weight (thickness) component of the fully-qualified font name or font specifier. The possible values are 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, or 900, where each number indicates a weight that is at least as dark as its predecessor. A value of 400 indicates a normal weight; 700 indicates bold. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, 300 in one font may appear most similar to 500 in another.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Flags
member.summary: (Required) A collection of flags defining various characteristics of the font.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontBBox
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) A rectangle (see Section 3.8.4, “Rectangles”), expressed in the glyph coordinate system, specifying the font bounding box. This is the smallest rectangle enclosing the shape that would result if all of the glyphs of the font were placed with their origins coincident and then filled.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.ItalicAngle
member.summary: (Required) The angle, expressed in degrees counterclockwise from the vertical, of the dominant vertical strokes of the font. (For example, the 9-o’clock position is 90 degrees, and the 3-o’clock position is –90 degrees.) The value is negative for fonts that slope to the right, as almost all italic fonts do.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Ascent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum height above the baseline reached by glyphs in this font, excluding the height of glyphs for accented characters.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Descent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum depth below the baseline reached by glyphs in this font. The value is a negative number.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Leading
member.summary: (Optional) The spacing between baselines of consecutive lines of text. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CapHeight
member.summary: (Required for fonts that have Latin characters, except for Type 3 fonts) The vertical coordinate of the top of flat capital letters, measured from the baseline.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.XHeight
member.summary: (Optional) The font’s x height: the vertical coordinate of the top of flat nonascending lowercase letters (like the letter x), measured from the baseline, in fonts that have Latin characters. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemV
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The thickness, measured horizontally, of the dominant vertical stems of glyphs in the font.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemH
member.summary: (Optional) The thickness, measured vertically, of the dominant horizontal stems of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.AvgWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The average width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MaxWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The maximum width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MissingWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The width to use for character codes whose widths are not specified in a font dictionary’s Widths array. This has a predictable effect only if all such codes map to glyphs whose actual widths are the same as the value of the MissingWidth entry. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile
member.summary: (Optional) A stream containing a Type 1 font program.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A stream containing a TrueType font program.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile3
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A stream containing a font program whose format is specified by the Subtype entry in the stream dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CharSet
member.summary: (Optional; meaningful only in Type 1 fonts; PDF 1.1) A string listing the character names defined in a font subset. The names in this string must be in PDF syntax—that is, each name preceded by a slash (/). The names can appear in any order. The name .notdef should be omitted; it is assumed to exist in the font subset. If this entry is absent, the only indication of a font subset is the subset tag in the FontName entry.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for a form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Form for a form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.FormType
member.summary: (Optional) A code identifying the type of form XObject that this dictionary describes. The only valid value defined at the time of publication is 1. Default value: 1.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.BBox
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the form coordinate system, giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the form XObject’s bounding box. These boundaries are used to clip the form XObject and to determine its size for caching.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Matrix
member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the form matrix, which maps form space into user space. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Resources
member.summary: (Optional but strongly recommended; PDF 1.2) A dictionary specifying any resources (such as fonts and images) required by the form XObject.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary indicating that the contents of the form XObject are to be treated as a group and specifying the attributes of that group (see Section 4.9.2, “Group XObjects”). Note: If a Ref entry (see below) is present, the group attributes also apply to the external page imported by that entry, which allows such an imported page to be treated as a group without further modification.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.
