member.summary: Add all inheritable values from the specified page to the specified values structure.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Page for a page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the immediate parent of this page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.LastModified
member.summary: (Required if PieceInfo is present; optional otherwise; PDF 1.3) The date and time when the page’s contents were most recently modified. If a page-piece dictionary (PieceInfo) is present, the modification date is used to ascertain which of the application data dictionaries that it contains correspond to the current content of the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.BleedBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.TrimBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.ArtBox
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the extent of the page’s meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the page’s creator. Default value: the value of CropBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.BoxColorInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A box color information dictionary specifying the colors and other visual characteristics to be used in displaying guidelines on the screen for the various page boundaries. If this entry is absent, the application should use its own current default settings.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Optional) A content stream describing the contents of this page. If this entry is absent, the page is empty. The value may be either a single stream or an array of streams. If the value is an array, the effect is as if all of the streams in the array were concatenated, in order, to form a single stream. This allows PDF producers to create image objects and other resources as they occur, even though they interrupt the content stream. The division between streams may occur only at the boundaries between lexical tokens but is unrelated to the page’s logical content or organization. Applications that consume or produce PDF files are not required to preserve the existing structure of the Contents array.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary specifying the attributes of the page’s page group for use in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Thumb
member.summary: (Optional) A stream object defining the page’s thumbnail image.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.B
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; recommended if the page contains article beads) An array of indirect references to article beads appearing on the page. The beads are listed in the array in natural reading order.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Dur
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The page’s display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page is displayed during presentations before the viewer application automatically advances to the next page. By default, the viewer does not advance automatically.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Trans
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A transition dictionary describing the transition effect to be used when displaying the page during presentations.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Annots
member.summary: (Optional) An array of annotation dictionaries representing annotations associated with the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining actions to be performed when the page is opened or closed.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PieceInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A page-piece dictionary associated with the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.StructParents
member.summary: (Required if the page contains structural content items; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the page’s entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the page’s parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PZ
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The page’s preferred zoom (magnification) factor: the factor by which it should be scaled to achieve the natural display magnification.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.SeparationInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A separation dictionary containing information needed to generate color separations for the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Tabs
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A name specifying the tab order to be used for annotations on the page. The possible values are R (row order), C (column order), and S (structure order).

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.TemplateInstantiated
member.summary: (Required if this page was created from a named page object; PDF 1.5) The name of the originating page object.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.PresSteps
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A navigation node dictionary representing the first node on the page.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.UserUnit
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) A positive number giving the size of default user space units, in multiples of 1/72 inch. The range of supported values is implementation-dependent.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.VP
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) An array of viewport dictionaries specifying rectangular regions of the page.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys
member.summary: Predefined keys common to PdfPage and PdfPages.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.Resources
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A dictionary containing any resources required by the page. If the page requires no resources, the value of this entry should be an empty dictionary. Omitting the entry entirely indicates that the resources are to be inherited from an ancestor node in the page tree.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.MediaBox
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page is intended to be displayed or printed.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.CropBox
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A rectangle, expressed in default user space units, defining the visible region of default user space. When the page is displayed or printed, its contents are to be clipped (cropped) to this rectangle and then imposed on the output medium in some implementation defined manner. Default value: the value of MediaBox.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritablePageKeys.Rotate
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The number of degrees by which the page should be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value must be a multiple of 90. Default value: 0.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage.InheritedValues
member.summary: Values inherited from a parent in the parent chain of a page tree.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPages
member.summary: Represents the pages of the document.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPages.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of pages.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPages.ImportExternalPage(PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfPage)
member.summary: Imports an external page. The elements of the imported page are cloned and added to this document. Important: In contrast to PdfFormXObject adding an external page always make a deep copy of their transitive closure. Any reuse of already imported objects is not intended because any modification of an imported page must not change another page.

member.summary: Represents the PDF document viewer preferences dictionary.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideToolbar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideMenubar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.CenterWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text: LeftToRight or RightToLeft (including vertical writing systems, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean). This entry has no direct effect on the document’s contents or page numbering but can be used to determine the relative positioning of pages when displayed side by side or printed n-up. Default value: LeftToRight.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideToolbar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideMenubar
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.HideWindowUI
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.FitWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.CenterWindow
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to position the document’s window in the center of the screen. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the Title entry of the document information dictionary. If false, the title bar should instead display the name of the PDF file containing the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: (Optional) The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode: UseNone Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible UseOutlines Document outline visible UseThumbs Thumbnail images visible UseOC Optional content group panel visible This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.Direction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The predominant reading order for text: L2R Left to right R2L Right to left (including vertical writing systems, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) This entry has no direct effect on the document’s contents or page numbering but can be used to determine the relative positioning of pages when displayed side by side or printed n-up. Default value: L2R.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.ViewArea
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be displayed when viewing the document on the screen. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.ViewClip
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when viewing the document on the screen. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintArea
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary representing the area of a page to be rendered when printing the document. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries as described in Section 10.10.1, “Page Boundaries.” Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintClip
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The name of the page boundary to which the contents of a page are to be clipped when printing the document. The value is the key designating the relevant page boundary in the page object. If the specified page boundary is not defined in the page object, its default value is used. Default value: CropBox. Note: This entry is intended primarily for use by prepress applications that interpret or manipulate the page boundaries. Most PDF consumer applications disregard it.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.Pdf.PdfViewerPreferences.Keys.PrintScaling
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.6) The page scaling option to be selected when a print dialog is displayed for this document. Valid values are None, which indicates that the print dialog should reflect no page scaling, and AppDefault, which indicates that applications should use the current print scaling. If this entry has an unrecognized value, applications should use the current print scaling. Default value: AppDefault. Note: If the print dialog is suppressed and its parameters are provided directly by the application, the value of this entry should still be used.

member.summary: Use _ instead of blanks and special characters. Can be complemented with a suffix in the NuGet Script. Nuspec Doc: The unique identifier for the package. This is the package name that is shown when packages are listed using the Package Manager Console. These are also used when installing a package using the Install-Package command within the Package Manager Console. Package IDs may not contain any spaces or characters that are invalid in an URL. In general, they follow the same rules as .NET namespaces do. So Foo.Bar is a valid ID, Foo! and Foo Bar are not.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Adler32
member.summary:
Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Checksums.Crc32
member.summary:
Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.
Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.
This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.
The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater
member.summary:
This is the Deflater class. The deflater class compresses input with the deflate algorithm described in RFC 1951. It has several compression levels and three different strategies described below.
This class is not thread safe. This is inherent in the API, due to the split of deflate and setInput.
Author of the original java version: Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The best and slowest compression level. This tries to find very long and distant string repetitions.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.BEST_SPEED
member.summary: The worst but fastest compression level.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The default compression level.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: This level won't compress at all but output uncompressed blocks.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.DEFLATED
member.summary: The compression method. This is the only method supported so far. There is no need to use this constant at all.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with default compression level.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.

member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new deflater with given compression level.
member.param: the compression level, a value between NO_COMPRESSION and BEST_COMPRESSION.
true, if we should suppress the Zlib/RFC1950 header at the beginning and the adler checksum at the end of the output. This is useful for the GZIP/PKZIP formats.
member.exception: if lvl is out of range.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Reset
member.summary: Resets the deflater. The deflater acts afterwards as if it was just created with the same compression level and strategy as it had before.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Adler
member.summary: Gets the current adler checksum of the data that was processed so far.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.TotalIn
member.summary: Gets the number of input bytes processed so far.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.TotalOut
member.summary: Gets the number of output bytes so far.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current input block. Further calls to deflate() will produce enough output to inflate everything in the current input block. This is not part of Sun's JDK so I have made it package private. It is used by DeflaterOutputStream to implement flush().

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Finish
member.summary: Finishes the deflater with the current input block. It is an error to give more input after this method was called. This method must be called to force all bytes to be flushed.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true if the stream was finished and no more output bytes are available.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method can also return true when the stream was finished.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. If you call setInput when needsInput() returns false, the previous input that is still pending will be thrown away. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again. This call is equivalent to setInput(input, 0, input.length).
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
member.exception: if the buffer was finished() or ended().

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetInput(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the data which should be compressed next. This should be only called when needsInput indicates that more input is needed. The given byte array should not be changed, before needsInput() returns true again.
member.param: the buffer containing the input data.
the number of data bytes of input.
member.exception: if the buffer was Finish()ed or if previous input is still pending.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the compression level. There is no guarantee of the exact position of the change, but if you call this when needsInput is true the change of compression level will occur somewhere near before the end of the so far given input.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.GetLevel
member.summary: Get current compression level
member.returns: Returns the current compression level

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetStrategy(PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflateStrategy)
member.summary: Sets the compression strategy. Strategy is one of DEFAULT_STRATEGY, HUFFMAN_ONLY and FILTERED. For the exact position where the strategy is changed, the same as for SetLevel() applies.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Deflates the current input block with to the given array.
member.param: The buffer where compressed data is stored
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished returns true or length is zero.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.Deflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deflates the current input block to the given array.
member.param: Buffer to store the compressed data.
The maximum number of bytes that may be stored.
member.returns: The number of compressed bytes added to the output, or 0 if either needsInput() or finished() returns true or length is zero.
member.exception: If offset or length don't match the array length.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. This call is equivalent to setDictionary(dict, 0, dict.Length).
member.exception: if SetInput () or Deflate () were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Deflater.SetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the dictionary which should be used in the deflate process. The dictionary is a byte array containing strings that are likely to occur in the data which should be compressed. The dictionary is not stored in the compressed output, only a checksum. To decompress the output you need to supply the same dictionary again.
member.param: The index where dictionary information commences.
The number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.exception: If SetInput () or Deflate() were already called or another dictionary was already set.

member.summary: This strategy will not look for string repetitions at all. It only encodes with Huffman trees (which means, that more common characters get a smaller encoding.

member.summary: Low level compression engine for deflate algorithm which uses a 32K sliding window with secondary compression from Huffman/Shannon-Fano codes.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.head
member.summary: Hashtable, hashing three characters to an index for window, so that window[index]..window[index+2] have this hash code. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.prev
member.summary: prev[index & WMASK] points to the previous index that has the same hash code as the string starting at index. This way entries with the same hash code are in a linked list. Note that the array should really be unsigned short, so you need to and the values with 0xffff.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.strstart
member.summary: Points to the current character in the window.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.lookahead
member.summary: lookahead is the number of characters starting at strstart in window that are valid. So window[strstart] until window[strstart+lookahead-1] are valid characters.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.DeflaterEngine.window
member.summary: This array contains the part of the uncompressed stream that is of relevance. The current character is indexed by strstart.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater
member.summary:
Inflater is used to decompress data that has been compressed according to the "deflate" standard described in rfc1951.
By default Zlib (rfc1950) headers and footers are expected in the input. You can use constructor public Inflater(bool noHeader) passing true if there is no Zlib header information
The usage is as following. First you have to set some input with SetInput(), then Inflate() it. If inflate doesn't inflate any bytes there may be three reasons:
IsNeedingInput() returns true because the input buffer is empty. You have to provide more input with SetInput(). NOTE: IsNeedingInput() also returns true when, the stream is finished.
IsNeedingDictionary() returns true, you have to provide a preset dictionary with SetDictionary().
IsFinished returns true, the inflater has finished.
Once the first output byte is produced, a dictionary will not be needed at a later stage.
Author of the original java version: John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.summary: Extra bits for literal codes 257..285

member.summary: Copy offsets for distance codes 0..29

member.summary: Extra bits for distance codes

member.summary: Inflates the compressed stream to the output buffer. If this returns 0, you should check, whether IsNeedingDictionary(), IsNeedingInput() or IsFinished() returns true, to determine why no further output is produced.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Inflate(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inflates the compressed stream to the output buffer. If this returns 0, you should check, whether needsDictionary(), needsInput() or finished() returns true, to determine why no further output is produced.
member.param: the offset in buffer where storing starts.
the maximum number of bytes to output.
member.returns: the number of bytes written to the buffer, 0 if no further output can be produced.
member.exception: if the index and / or count are wrong.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsNeedingInput
member.summary: Returns true, if the input buffer is empty. You should then call setInput(). NOTE: This method also returns true when the stream is finished.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsNeedingDictionary
member.summary: Returns true, if a preset dictionary is needed to inflate the input.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.IsFinished
member.summary: Returns true, if the inflater has finished. This means, that no input is needed and no output can be produced.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.Adler
member.summary: Gets the adler checksum. This is either the checksum of all uncompressed bytes returned by inflate(), or if needsDictionary() returns true (and thus no output was yet produced) this is the adler checksum of the expected dictionary.
member.returns: the adler checksum.

member.summary: Gets the total number of processed compressed input bytes.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Inflater.RemainingInput
member.summary: Gets the number of unprocessed input bytes. Useful, if the end of the stream is reached and you want to further process the bytes after the deflate stream.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.InflaterInputStream
member.summary:
This filter stream is used to decompress data compressed using the "deflate" format. The "deflate" format is described in RFC 1951.
This stream may form the basis for other decompression filters, such as the GZipInputStream.
Author of the original java version: John Leuner.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator
member.summary:
This class allows us to retrieve a specified number of bits from the input buffer, as well as copy big byte blocks.
It uses an int buffer to store up to 31 bits for direct manipulation. This guarantees that we can get at least 16 bits, but we only need at most 15, so this is all safe.
There are some optimizations in this class, for example, you must never peek more than 8 bits more than needed, and you must first peek bits before you may drop them. This is not a general purpose class but optimized for the behaviour of the Inflater.
Authors of the original java version: John Leuner, Jochen Hoenicke

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a default StreamManipulator with all buffers empty

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.PeekBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next sequence of bits but don't increase input pointer. bitCount must be less or equal 16 and if this call succeeds, you must drop at least n - 8 bits in the next call.
member.param: The number of bits to peek.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available. */

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.DropBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Drops the next n bits from the input. You should have called PeekBits with a bigger or equal n before, to make sure that enough bits are in the bit buffer.
member.param: The number of bits to drop.

member.name: M:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.GetBits(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next n bits and increases input pointer. This is equivalent to followed by , except for correct error handling.
member.param: The number of bits to retrieve.
member.returns: the value of the bits, or -1 if not enough bits available.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.Compression.Streams.StreamManipulator.AvailableBits
member.summary: Gets the number of bits available in the bit buffer. This must be only called when a previous PeekBits() returned -1.
member.returns: the number of bits available.

member.summary: Gets the number of bytes available.
member.returns: The number of bytes available.

member.summary: Skips to the next byte boundary.

member.summary: Returns true when SetInput can be called

member.summary: Copies bytes from input buffer to output buffer starting at output[offset]. You have to make sure, that the buffer is byte aligned. If not enough bytes are available, copies fewer bytes.
member.param: The buffer to copy bytes to.
The offset in the buffer at which copying starts
The length to copy, 0 is allowed.
member.returns: The number of bytes copied, 0 if no bytes were available.

member.name: T:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags
member.summary: Defines the contents of the general bit flags field for an archive entry.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Encrypted
member.summary: Bit 0 if set indicates that the file is encrypted

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Method
member.summary: Bits 1 and 2 - Two bits defining the compression method (only for Method 6 Imploding and 8,9 Deflating)

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Descriptor
member.summary: Bit 3 if set indicates a trailing data desciptor is appended to the entry data

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPKware4
member.summary: Bit 4 is reserved for use with method 8 for enhanced deflation

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Patched
member.summary: Bit 5 if set indicates the file contains Pkzip compressed patched data. Requires version 2.7 or greater.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.StrongEncryption
member.summary: Bit 6 if set indicates strong encryption has been used for this entry.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused7
member.summary: Bit 7 is currently unused

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused8
member.summary: Bit 8 is currently unused

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused9
member.summary: Bit 9 is currently unused

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.Unused10
member.summary: Bit 10 is currently unused

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.UnicodeText
member.summary: Bit 11 if set indicates the filename and comment fields for this file must be encoded using UTF-8.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.EnhancedCompress
member.summary: Bit 12 is documented as being reserved by PKware for enhanced compression.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.HeaderMasked
member.summary: Bit 13 if set indicates that values in the local header are masked to hide their actual values, and the central directory is encrypted.
member.remarks: Used when encrypting the central directory contents.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware14
member.summary: Bit 14 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.GeneralBitFlags.ReservedPkware15
member.summary: Bit 15 is documented as being reserved for use by PKware

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DataDescriptorSignature
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: F:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.EXTSIG
member.summary: Signature for data descriptor
member.remarks: This is only used where the length, Crc, or compressed size isnt known when the entry is created and the output stream doesnt support seeking. The local entry cannot be 'patched' with the correct values in this case so the values are recorded after the data prefixed by this header, as well as in the central directory.

member.name: P:PdfSharp.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipConstants.DefaultCodePage
member.summary: Default encoding used for string conversion. 0 gives the default system OEM code page. Dont use unicode encodings if you want to be Zip compatible! Using the default code page isnt the full solution necessarily there are many variable factors, codepage 850 is often a good choice for European users, however be careful about compatibility.
